gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Boosting Resilient and Inclusive Growth (BRIG) in The Bahamas 2021, Phase 1

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Final report for the BRIG project
Shared Drive containing all the data and information about the BRIG project

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: To assist The Bahamas in achieving its goals for the Blue Economy, the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) is working with the country in the development and implementation of a policy-based loan aimed at "Boosting Resilient and Inclusive Growth in The Bahamas." To support measures of loan effectiveness, we have updated baseline estimates for indicators of the value of ecosystem services provided by the MPAS, specifically: (i) coastal risk reduction benefits provided by ecosystems within MPAs for nearby communities and (ii) the contribution of nursery habitats within MPAs to spiny lobster fisheries. To update baseline estimates of these indicators, we have conducted spatially explicit assessments of coastal risk reduction and nursery habitat benefits of the network of MPAs using new information provided by new data technologies and Bahamian experts. Furthermore, we quantified the benefits associated with the expansion of the MPA network that occurred mid-project (July 2021) when new MPAs and MPA boundary expansions were gazetted (Bahamas Protected Areas Fund, 2021). Our process consisted of three interrelated components, (1) engaging with key ministries, academic departments, NGOs, and other experts in The Bahamas, (2) updating key data inputs to the ecosystem service models, and (3) using the InVEST Coastal Vulnerability and Spiny Lobster models to produce new baseline estimates of the key indicators.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: Update the baseline conditions in Marine Protected Areas (MPA) in The Bahamas using the most recent and best available data sets. Quantify the ecosystem services provided by habitats with the MPAs. This baseline can be used to monitor any changes over time.

gmd:keyword.gco:CharacterString: REQUIRED: EXAMPLE: EARTH SCIENCE > BIOSPHERE > AQUATIC ECOSYSTEMS > COASTAL HABITAT
